Sections.Name: Domains
Sections.Description:
Please click on any topic to learn about resources that can help you manage that part of your life. 

  Though resources were carefully selected by our team of researchers and clinicians, the University of Virginia does not endorse these resources.

Parameters.Text: Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

A How-to Guide for Setting Better Goals

Setting your own goals can be done in just four simple steps.

https://advanced-hindsight.com/blog/a-how-to-guide-for-setting-better-goals/

Virginia Workforce Connection

Your gateway to employment and labor market information in Virginia.

https://vawc.virginia.gov/vosnet/Default.aspx



Application and Interview Tips

Review best practices and learn to avoid common missteps.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sLffu1MWzqU



Virginia Career Works

Virginia Career Works is Virginia’s vital link between meaningful employment and growing businesses. Learn more about what they provide.

https://virginiacareerworks.com/

How to Handle Conflict in the Workplace

Learn about some practical strategies you can use to handle conflict in the workplace.

https://blink.ucsd.edu/HR/supervising/conflict/handle.html#8.-Build-on-your-success.



How to Interact With Difficult People

Learn practical strategies you can use to develop better working relationships with difficult people.

https://blink.ucsd.edu/HR/supervising/conflict/interact.html



How to Handle Conflict at Work

You don't have to figure out workplace conflict alone; a team of conflict-resolution experts have assembled tips to help you face workplace conflict head-on.

https://www.npr.org/2022/04/07/1091455113/how-to-handle-conflict-at-work



Contact Your HR Department

Don't hesitate to reach out to your Human Resources department when faced with workplace conflict; you are not alone.
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Healthy Families of Charlottesville/Albemarle

Healthy Families fosters nurturing family relationships for pregnant moms and safe environments for young children through regular home visiting.

https://readykidscville.org/family-support/healthy-families/



REAL Dads

REAL Dads coaches incarcerated fathers and fathers who want a stronger relationship with their children to have Responsible, Empowered, Available and Loving relationships with their families.

https://readykidscville.org/family-support/real-dads/



Region Ten Child and Family Services

The Child and Family Services center provides prevention, substance use and mental health services to the children and families in our community. The goals of these services are to help families build resiliency and keep children/youth safely in their homes and communities when possible.

https://regionten.org/service-type/children-family/



Virginia Association of Community Service Boards - CSB Directory

Use this Community Service Board directory to find locally-provided mental health services in your area.

https://vacsb.org/csb-bha-directory/



Virginia Department of Social Services

VDSS is one of the largest Commonwealth agencies, partnering with 120 local departments of social services, along with faith-based and non-profit organizations, to promote the well-being of children and families statewide.

https://www.dss.virginia.gov/



Child Youth, and Family Services Offices in Virginia

Search here to find Virginia's child, youth, and family services offices.

https://www.countyoffice.org/va-child-family-youth-services/

FEAP Clothing Resources

FEAP offers resources for general clothing, maternity and baby clothing, and laundry services.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/clothing-resources



FEAP Housing and Utlility Resources

FEAP offers resources for renting, affordable housing, and utilities.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/housing-and-utility-resources



FEAP Food Resources

FEAP offers resources for food banks and public meal programs, delivered food resources, and state food assistance.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/food-resources



UMA Social Worker

Contact a social worker through UMA to help with security needs.





myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship. It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/



Food Stamp Offices in Virginia

Search here to find Virginia's food stamp offices.

https://www.countyoffice.org/food-stamp-office/

Piedmont Hospice

Hospice of the Piedmont is a community-based nonprofit hospice that has offered expert care and peaceful resolution to Virginia families for over 40 years.

https://hopva.org/



Grieving: TIPS for living in a time of loss

Advice for people struggling with the loss of a loved one.

https://womenscenter.virginia.edu/2021/03/grieving-tips-living-time-loss
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Financial Wellness: Shifting from How Much You Have to How You Use It

Learn about what financial wellness means and how to achieve it in your own life

https://www.eudaimonicbydesign.com/resilience/financial



Tools from UVA Community Credit Union

Interested in learning about managing your money, investing, or even buying a house? Attend a free, one-hour seminar through UVA Community Credit Union

https://www.uvacreditunion.org/content/Education-And-Tools

Financial Resources

This comprehensive list cultivated by the UVA Faculty and Employee Assistance Program (FEAP) can help you meet your financial needs.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/financial-resources

FEAP Food Resources

Food assistance, delivered food resources.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/food-resources



FEAP Housing and Utilities Resources

Resources available in the Charlottesville and Albemarle County area.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/housing-and-utility-resources



FEAP Transportation Resources

Bus and other transportation services.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/transportation-resources



FEAP Clothing Resources

Looking for discounted or affordable clothing? Check out this list of local clothing resources.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/clothing-resources



UMA Social Worker

Contact a social worker through UMA to help with food and housing needs.





Food Stamp Offices in Virginia

Search here to find Virginia's food stamp offices.

https://www.countyoffice.org/food-stamp-office/



211

Call 211 for essential community services; 211 connects you to expert, caring help. Every call is completely confidential.

https://www.211.org/
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Mindfulness Information Videos

Learn more about mindfulness from two of UVA’s Mindfulness Center Instructors.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/about/intro-to-mindfulness/



Mindfulness Recommended Reading

Readings, videos, and transcripts with information on mindfulness and how to incorporate it into your lifestyle.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/continue-your-practice/recommended-reading/



UCSD Mindfulness & Compassion Resources

The UC San Diego Center for Mindfulness resource page offers the various resources, in the form of information and links, in their continued efforts to provide individual and community support.

https://cih.ucsd.edu/mindfulness/mindfulness-compassion-resources



Compassionate Care Initiative

The UVA School of Nursing’s Compassionate Care Initiative (CCI) offers ongoing, weekly sessions on mindfulness meditation, mindful movement, yoga, and more. All drop-in sessions are free; no registration or previous experience required!

https://cci.nursing.virginia.edu/activities/calendar/



UVA Mindfulness Center

Check out the Mindfulness Center for meditation and other stress-reduction online classes, events, recordings, and resources.

https://med.virginia.edu/mindfulness-center/programs/



UVA Contemplative Sciences Center

Check out the CSC for various yoga and mindfulness courses.

https://csc.virginia.edu/feature/contemplative-classes-yoga-mindfulness-and-more

FEAP Resources in Support of Social Justice

Check out these virtual resources regarding education, action, reflection, and self-care to help acknowledge the pain of injustices suffered, offer support to those hurting or distressed, and offfer resources for those who want to learn and respond to foster social justice.

https://uvafeap.com/services/virtual-resources-library/resources-support-social-justice



FEAP Positive Psychology

A FEAP counseling with a Positive Psychology Practitioner can provide you with information on the field of Positive Psychology and how you can learn to thrive more in your life.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/positive-psychology



How to Stress More Effectively

Learn about how you can think about stress more positively

https://uvafeap.com/sites/feap/files/PDFs/Tip%20of%20the%20Month/FEAP%20Tip%20of%20the%20Month_April%2020_2021.pdf



Cultivating Optimism

Optimism is good for you -- and for those around you. Learn how to cultivate it!

https://uvafeap.com/sites/feap/files/PDFs/Tip%20of%20the%20Month/FEAP%20Tip%20of%20the%20Month_March%2016_2021_final.pdf



FEAP Virtual Resources for Stress Management

Check out these resources to help support your mental and emotional wellness.

https://uvafeap.com/services/virtual-resources-library/virtual-resources-support-stress-management

Women's Initiative

Through the Women's Initiative, the Sister Circle program aims to address the needs of Black women living in Charlottesville.

https://thewomensinitiative.org/sister-circle/



Virginia Association of Community Service Boards - CSB Directory

Use this Community Service Board directory to find locally-provided mental health services in your area.

https://vacsb.org/csb-bha-directory/



UMA Primary Care Physician

Talk to your primary care physician about ways to work through mental health concerns. You are not alone





988

The 988 Lifeline provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for you or your loved ones, and best practices for professionals in the United States.

https://988lifeline.org/



Partner for Mental Health

Looking for mental illness support, referrals, or educational opportunities? Check out this resource that stands up for the rights and dignity of those with mental illness as they engage in treatment or in the justice system, while supporting creative solutions to interpersonal and legal challenges caused by mental illness.

https://partnerformentalhealth.org/



The Counseling Alliance of Virginia (CAVA)

Check out CAVA for counseling needs regarding the impact of mental illness, substance abuse, trauma, and/or other life stressors. CAVA offers a variety of clinical specialists who practice several different approaches to treatment.

https://www.cavahelps.com/



Region Ten

Looking for mental health support? Region Ten offers several services for mental health, including case management, intellectual disability, substance use, rehabilitation, and counseling.

https://regionten.org/services/



Central Virginia Clinicans of Color Network (CVCCN)

CVCCN is a supportive network that empowers clinicians of color and builds capacity for providing culturally responsive mental health treatment.

https://cvccn.org/



The Women's Initiative

Provides culturally based trauma supportive services and culturally responsive counseling services, support groups, social support options, outreach and education. Includes FREE WALK-IN CLINICS: Free walk-in wellness sessions for immediate, short-term assistance including eligibility screenings, self- care assessments, information and referral services, education and emotional support.

https://thewomensinitiative.org



100 Black Men

Working to improve the quality of life within the community and advocate eliminating the achievement gap of African American (AA) male students through mentoring by the members.

https://www.100bmocv.org



Boris Lawrence Henson Foundation

Free virtual support for Blacks/African-Americans

https://www.borislhensonfoundation.org



Counseling Alliance of VA

Culturally based trauma supportive services and culturally responsive counseling services

https://www.cavahelps.com/



Creciendo Juntos

Resources and supportive services for Latinx individuals and families

https://www.cj-network.org/



National Alliance for Hispanic Health

Culturally based trauma supportive services and culturally responsive counseling services

https://www.healthyamericas.org



National Coalition of Black Women-Charlottesville Metropolitan area

Advocating on behalf of Black women and girls to promote leadership development and gender equity

http://www.100bwcville.org



Therapy for Black Girls

Podcast centered around mental wellness for Black women

https://therapyforblackgirls.com/podcast/



VDH Division of Multicultural Health and Community Engagement

Programs and partnerships to empower racial and ethnic minority communities to promote awareness of health inequities.

https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/health-equity/division-of-multicultural-health-and-community-engagement/



Equality VA

Leading statewide non-partisan advocacy, outreach, and educational organizations seeking equality for LGBTQ Virginians.

https://equalityvirginia.org



PFLAG Blue Ridge: Charlottesville Anti-Violence Project

Provides information, peer support, education, and advocacy for LGBTQ+ persons, their families, and their friends. Visit their website for contact information, as well as meeting schedules.

https://pflagblueridge.org/charlottesville.html



Planned Parenthood

Provides family planning, sexual health and sexually transmitted infection services. Offering the morning after pill, abortion services, educational and outreach services in the community. Offers education, resources, services, and referrals for any client identifying as LGBT+. Visit their website to make an appointment.

https://plannedparenthood.org



Side by Side

Weekly curriculum based support groups for LGBTQ youth ages 14-20. Information and referrals for youth and families; training opportunities available for professionals and community agencies.

https://www.sidebysideva.org/



The Women's Initiative

Provides culturally based trauma supportive services and culturally responsive counseling services, support groups, social support options, outreach and education. Includes FREE WALK-IN CLINICS: Free walk-in wellness sessions for immediate, short-term assistance including eligibility screenings, self- care assessments, information and referral services, education and emotional support.

https://thewomensinitiative.org



Trans Lifeline

A non-profit hotline staffed by transgender volunteers for people who are experiencing difficulty or crisis.

https://translifeline.org



Transgender Health Alliance of Central Virginia

Provides quality, aiffirming healthcare resources, referral options, and information for all members of the transgender community.

https://www.thacva.org



VA Anti-Violence Project

Provides advocacy and support services for LGBTQ+-identified survivors of violence, including individual and group support, individual and systems advocacy, and accompaniment; relationship classes, and trainings to professionals/community organizations on LGBTQ+ issues and challenges.

https://virginiaavp.org



UVA Teen & Young Adult Health Center

Comprehensive healthcare services to teens and young adults up to age 26, including transgender health services, mental health assessment, eating disorder assessment and treatment and mental health assessments. Most insurance accepted and financial assistance is available.

https://uvahealth.com/services/lgbtq
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Quit Now Virginia - Tobacco Free Living

Since 2005, Quit Now Virginia has been a leading tool for helping tobacco and nicotine users quit their addiction. Thousands of people have contacted 1.800.Quit Now!

https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/tobacco-free-living/quit-now-virginia/



Drink Less - Better Help

Any reduction in the amount you drink every week will be beneficial – and with the right help, it's easier than you think.

https://www.nhs.uk/better-health/drink-less/



Quit Smoking - Better Help

Even if you’ve tried before, maybe more than once, you can still succeed. What you’ve already learned will help you reach your goal of becoming an ex-smoker. Check out advice, tools and tips here.

https://www.nhs.uk/better-health/quit-smoking/



UMA Primary Care Physician

Talk to your primary care physician about ways to work through substance use and addiction.





SAMHSA National Helpline

The Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration's National Helpline is a free, confidential, 24/7, 365-day-a-year treatment referral and information service (in English and Spanish) for individuals and families facing mental and/or substance use disorders.

https://www.samhsa.gov/find-help/national-helpline

VDH Physical Activity Recommendations

Visit the Virginia Department of Health Physical Activity site for physical activity information and recommendations.

https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/healthy-communities/physical-activity/



How to Be More Active

Here are some simple ideas to build more activity into your day, tips to stick with it and free exercise plans to help you get going.

https://www.nhs.uk/better-health/get-active/how-to-be-more-active/



Getting Active

The American Heart Association has the tools and resources to get you on the right path to a healthier lifestyle.

https://www.heart.org/en/healthy-living/fitness/getting-active



What Doctors Wish Patients Knew About Increasing Physical Activity

This installment of the AMA’s "What Doctors WIsh Patient's Knew" discusses what patients need to know about physical activity.

https://www.ama-assn.org/delivering-care/public-health/what-doctors-wish-patients-knew-about-increasing-physical-activity



Physical Activity Basics

Regular physical activity is one of the most important things you can do for your health. Learn more about it here.

https://www.cdc.gov/physicalactivity/basics/index.htm



FEAP Aging Resources

Resources for aging needs including temporary in-home care.

https://uvafeap.com/counseling-services/community-resources-support/aging-resources



5 Easy Ways to Get More Active

This site outlines 5 easy ways to start and sustain a more active lifestyle that have been tested in countless research studies.

https://www.sbm.org/healthy-living/5-easy-ways-to-get-more-active?gad=1&gclid=EAIaIQobChMI-4nLx9P_gAMVELXICh27dQ44EAAYAyAAEgIV8fD_BwE

Virginia Family Nutrition Program

The Virginia Family Nutrition Program (FNP) empowers Virginians to take charge of their health by eating healthy and living an active lifestyle. We teach limited resource households how to make healthier food choices and become better managers of available food resources for optimal health and growth.

https://eatsmartmovemoreva.org/nourish/#:~:text=The%20Virginia%20Family%20Nutrition%20Program,for%20optimal%20health%20and%20growth.



Healthy Eating for a Healthy Weight

An eating plan that helps promote health and manage your weight includes a variety of healthy foods. Learn more about creating the ideal eating plan for you.

https://www.cdc.gov/healthyweight/healthy_eating/index.html



Nutrition Counseling:

Meet with a Registered Dietitian for individualized guidance on how to nourish yourself.

https://uvahealth.com/services/nutrition/classes

Planned Parenthood

Check out Planned Parenthood for both informational resources on STDs, pregnancy, birth control options, and more, or to schedule an in-person or telehealth appointment with a medical professional.

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/



Planned Parenthood: Pregnancy Information

Check out this resource on prenatal care, fertility treatments, pregnancy options, postpartum depression, and more!

https://www.plannedparenthood.org/learn/pregnancy



VDH Family Planning Resources

Visit the Virginia Department of Health Family Planning site for information and services related to reproductive health.

https://www.vdh.virginia.gov/family-planning/



UMA Primary Care Physician

Don't hesitate to talk to your primary care physician about your reproductive health.





Thrive Central Virginia

Check out this center for both its 24/7 helpline and both walk-in or scheduled appointments regarding pregnancy testing, confidential options counseling, abortion information, ultrasounds, pregnancy support, post-abortion care and support, and more!

https://thrivecentralva.org/
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Sexual Assault Resource Agency

The Sexual Assault Resource Agency (SARA) provides free, confidential support services for survivors of all genders.

https://saracville.org



myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship. It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/



The National Domestic Violence Hotline

Everyone deserves healthy relationships. When you're ready, we're here to listen.

https://www.thehotline.org/



988

The 988 Lifeline provides 24/7, free and confidential support for people in distress, prevention and crisis resources for you or your loved ones, and best practices for professionals in the United States.

https://988lifeline.org/



Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE)

The Shelter for Help in Emergency (SHE) offers trauma-based resources for survivors of domestic violence and aims at creating a community of empowerment and support.

https://www.shelterforhelpinemergency.org



myPlan App

A free app to help with safety decisions if you, or someone you care about, is experiencing abuse in their intimate relationship. It’s private, secure, personalized, & backed by research.

https://www.myplanapp.org/

National Healthy Marriage Resource Center

The Natioanl Healthy Marriage Resource Center offers a variety of resources to help married couples develop a healthier relationship.

http://www.healthymarriageinfo.org



The Gottman Institute

The Gottman Institute is focused on improving the well-being of marriages, families, and relationships through a research-based approach.

https://www.gottman.com/about/
Click on the specific topic to see associated resources.

Events in Virginia

Virginia is home to countless events and festivals no matter what the season. Mark your calendar and make this a year to remember.

https://www.virginia.org/events/

https://www.virginia.org/events/



UVA Employee Volunteer Resource Hub

Volunteering can offer a great opportunity to connect with other people across your community. The UVA Employee Volunteer Resource Hub provides a variety of volunteering opportunities within Charlottesville and beyond.

https://hr.virginia.edu/time/volunteer-center

Find law enforcement agencies by name, type, or location.

Womens Initiative -- Sister Circle

Sister Circle offers a social support group to meet the needs of people from across the African diaspora who identify as women in various ways: one of which being, recognizing the unique mental health challenges and trauma created by anti-Black racism and systemic oppression of BIPOC individuals.

https://thewomensinitiative.org/sister-circle

The Women's Initiative

Provides culturally based trauma supportive services and culturally responsive counseling services, support groups, social support options, outreach and education. Includes FREE WALK-IN CLINICS: Free walk-in wellness sessions for immediate, short-term assistance including eligibility screenings, self- care assessments, information and referral services, education and emotional support.

Working to improve the quality of life within the community and advocate eliminating the achievement gap of African American (AA) male students through mentoring by the members.

https://www.100bmocv.org



Boris Lawrence Henson Foundation

Free virtual support for Blacks/African-Americans

https://www.borislhensonfoundation.org



Central Virginia Clinicians of Color Network

Temporary NON-CRISIS emotional support by phone for adult people of color on Wednesdays 5–8pm during COVID-19 outbreak. Call during this time and/or leave your name, phone, and email to receive a call back. If demand exceeds available resources, our team will make every effort to connect you with appropriate care.

https://cvccn.org/

Culturally based trauma supportive services and culturally responsive counseling services

https://www.cavahelps.com/

Sister Circle Presents...10 Self-Care Tips for Black Women

Looking to engage in some self-care? Here's 10 ways you can!

https://static1.squarespace.com/static/50a50853e4b013b04b89ffc5/t/5ed80f43b6b8fc226c25e275/1591218015612/2020-06+Sister+Circle+Self-Care+Tips.pdf



Tool Kits & Resources from the Black Emotional and Mental Health Collective

Explore different ways that you can care for your emotional and mental health

https://www.beam.community/tool-kits-education

Talking About Race

Conversations about race are important -- here's how you can do them right.

https://nmaahc.si.edu/learn/talking-about-race



The Guide to Allyship

Interetsed in learning what it takes to be an effective ally? Here's a guide.

https://guidetoallyship.com/?fbclid=IwAR1TfKMWgVCGshdjbJaT7z5ZgVPGa76i0mzOmSVmzOgEdosOJ0j4UPFKOcQ



How Organizations Can Support the Mental Health of Black Employees

Here's how you can support the mental health of your colleagues that identify as Black

https://hbr.org/2020/06/how-organizations-can-support-the-mental-health-of-black-employees
